title: Drew Barrymore set to host her own daytime talk show: 'It is beyond my wildest dreams'
text:
She's an actress, producer, director and mother.

And Drew Barrymore is set to add talk show host to that long list of accomplishments, according to Variety on Thursday.

'The actress is set to headline a syndicated talk show for CBS Television Distribution, which is aiming at a fall 2020 launch,' reported the industry site.

All I do is win: Drew Barrymore, 44, is set to add talk show host to her long list of accomplishments, according to Variety on Thursday. Seen here in April 2019

The E.T. star shot a pilot for the show 'back in August', and the series is to be produced and distributed by CBS Television Distribution, according to Variety.

In a statement, the 44-year-old said, 'It is beyond my wildest dreams to have this opportunity for a daily talk show.'

'I’m truly thrilled and honored to be creating this show with CBS.'

New project: 'The actress is set to headline a syndicated talk show for CBS Television Distribution, which is aiming at a fall 2020 launch,' reported the industry site. Drew seen here in May 2019

In addition to her lengthy acting career, Barrymore has recently focused on her work as a TV producer and personality.

The mother-of-two served as a judge on the recent CBS talent show World's Best, as well as providing voiceover for NBC dating show First Dates.

Recently, Drew has served as Executive Producer on such shows as Santa Clarita Diet, Rattled and the 2011 TV reboot of Charlie's Angels.
description: Drew Barrymore is set to add talk show host to her very long list of accomplishments, according to Variety on Thursday.
